editorialNotes.standard: Swing, batta batta! Cheeky heckling and memorable stars make this remastered classic as fun as we remember.

ios.subtitle: Roll the Dice, Pass Go & Win

editorialNotes.standard: Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp lives on! This offline version of the beloved management sim includes all the original content, plus a few new surprises.

After a long day at work, it’s bath time! But Swampy’s shower is broken and he needs your help to guide the water to him. Navigate a path through the dirt past contraptions and obstacles to get every drop to fill the bath.

name: Ticket to Ride® The Board Game

editorialNotes.tagline: Get a job and have kids with a spin

ios.subtitle: Take It To The Next Level
New Style of Air Hockey game.

editorialNotes.standard: You might get stuck the first time you play Gorogoa. But once the gears of your brain settle into the right configurations, you’ll see how smart this mix of art and perspective really is. Layers pile upon layers, doors transport you between realities, strange creatures and wild environments blend together into a fascinating interactive collage you’ll want to peel apart to discover what lies underneath.

A rare kind of triumph, Prune takes a simple idea—pruning trees—and shapes it into a creative, deeply playable puzzle game. The visuals echo the style of Japanese painting in striking fashion, and the beautiful music instills a contemplative tone as you swipe to trim the limbs of a rapidly growing tree and guide it around obstacles. There’s no frantic pace, no demanding skills to master—only a quietly bewitching and unforgettable experience.
editorialNotes.short: A contemplative and creative experience - trimming trees has never been so beautiful.

editorialNotes.standard: Ancient Egyptians loved cats, Metallica hasn’t played the Super Bowl, and the Ganges is India’s largest river—all our useless knowledge is now coming in handy thanks to Trivia Crack. This bite-sized trivia game is totally irresistible, whether we’re dominating our Facebook friends in classic mode, trouncing strangers in the 12-question challenge mode, or just sneaking in a game on our Apple Watch. With its cute characters, heaps of unlockable achievements, and a massive variety of questions, we simply can’t get enough.

name: Ice Hockey PRO: game for watch

ios.subtitle: Unlock the Magic Fish of Isola
A story about love and life

editorialNotes.standard: There is a subtle beauty to Florence. This poignant love story intertwines a succinct narrative with smart interaction design to create moments of surprising emotional weight. Conversations are turned into puzzles that evolve as the characters’ moods shift. Memories fade into focus like old Polaroid photos. The way you touch the screen becomes just as important as the plot, which makes for a story you want to steer as well as follow. Florence fosters a rare sense of intimacy with its characters, creating an impression that lingers long after the story ends.

ios.subtitle: Adopt a family in your pocket!

editorialNotes.standard: An unforgettable adventure awaits in developer Thatgamecompany’s acclaimed hit Journey. Make your way to a distant mountain by skimming across sand dunes, scaling snowy cliffs, and exploring ancient ruins. Your magical scarf will power you over obstacles—though if you need a hand, link up with fellow travelers for fleeting moments of cooperative joy. Staggeringly beautiful and timelessly poignant, Journey is a trip well worth taking.

Tap on almost anything in this stellar hidden object game and you might giggle when you realize voice actors supplied almost all the sound effects. Because the game has no time limit, you’re free to relax and fully explore every homespun level and discover all the strange and endearing secrets, like tapping on a snake to pop a chicken out of its mouth.
editorialNotes.short: Search for hidden people and objects in detailed, hand-drawn landscapes.

name: THE GAME OF LIFE: Road Trip

editorialNotes.tagline: Twist on a classic board game

ios.subtitle: The family game of your life!

editorialNotes.standard: Zipping down snowy hills, trying to stay ahead of a massive avalanche—the pressure’s always on in this infinite-racing classic. And we love that whirlwind pace, fueled by landing backflips and hitching rides on penguins, snowmobiles, and yetis. From the game’s masterful one-touch controls to its cheery music, every aspect feels perfectly tuned to keep you playing through long afternoons and late nights.

name: Abby Monkey Basic Skills Pre K
artistName: 22LEARN Toddler and Baby Learning Games, LLC

editorialNotes.standard: Bizarre doesn’t even begin to explain Young Horses’ laugh-out-loud game. You control a father who’s secretly an octopus, and moving the bendy protagonist around makes for hysterically madcap fun. You’ll slip, slap, and slide your way through stages stacked with objects for you to interact with—mostly by crashing into them. Octodad’s hilariously animated chaos is wacky and simply irresistible.
editorialNotes.short: Get married, raise some kids - but don't give away that you're an octopus.

name: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
artistName: Sony Pictures Television UK Rights Limited

ios.subtitle: Play the Official TV Game Show

editorialNotes.standard: Scurry to victory with mountains of cheese by stealing from friends and evading the mousetrap in this lively digital reimagining of the popular board game.

What’s made OLO game one of our multiplayer favorites since 2012? The way it perfectly captures the friendly fun of real-world shuffleboard and air hockey. Virtually anyone can jump into a match (locally or online) and have an amazing time flicking discs into the target zone for points—and slyly knocking an opponent’s discs away to lower their score. Elegant and irresistible, Sennep’s all-ages masterpiece lets up to four players enjoy games that can be as casual or hardcore as everyone wants them to be.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

ios.subtitle: A tale of five tree creatures

editorialNotes.standard: Meditating on mortality and relationships is as important as hitting sweet shots in this beautifully atmospheric pinball game.

If you can doodle, you can play this one-of-a-kind Apple Design Award winner. Just draw a line—any line—and watch it spring to life across the screen, following your gestures to collect colored dots and avoid black holes. But as the holes form increasingly elaborate obstacles, only the most ingenious doodles will do. With endless solutions to every challenge, it’s a stylish, supremely satisfying test of your creativity and puzzle-solving prowess.

ios.subtitle: Be a chef and cook food!
Save some paper and avoid math
a love story about letting go.
Play and care for the cute pet

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

ios.subtitle: The official SET card game app

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

ios.subtitle: You can become a great artist!

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Three reasons you must play—or replay—LucasArts’ classic adventure: (1) The time-jumping story and quirky characters are as entertaining as ever. (2) So many clever puzzles and funny gags. (3) With beautifully updated graphics and sound, a slick new control scheme, and developer commentary, this remaster was clearly a labor of love.
